item.title: EL CHIDIAC: Why does Canada follow UN guidelines in its war on smokers?
item.description: Most Canadians are unaware of the WHO’s Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC), despite Canada signing and ratifying it 20 years ago. The treaty, adopted by 182 countries, influences smoking and harm reduction policies worldwide. In Canada, critics argue that FCTC’s strict regulations have led to a rigid, anti-harm-reduction stance that may be harming smokers seeking to quit. (Published on May 25, 2025bywesternstandard.news)

item.title: Disposable vapes save lives. Why ban them?
item.description: In a week, the UK will ban disposable vapes, a policy supported by politicians from different parties. While hailed as a moment of unity, it is seen as a policy disaster. Despite claims of a surge in youth vaping, a study revealed a less dramatic increase mainly among young adults, not children. The ban overlooks the positive impact of vapes in helping smokers quit, as seen in personal experiences like quitting a daily smoking habit. (Published on May 26, 2025byspectator.co.uk)
